title: Rhinanthus
text:
Rhinanthus (rattle) is a genus of annual <a href="parasitic%20plant">hemiparasitic</a> <a href="herbaceous%20plant">herbaceous plant</a>s in the family <a href="Orobanchaceae">Orobanchaceae</a>, formerly classified in the family <a href="Scrophulariaceae">Scrophulariaceae</a>. The genus consists of about 30 to 40 species found in <a href="Europe">Europe</a>, northern <a href="Asia">Asia</a>, and <a href="North%20America">North America</a>, with the greatest species diversity (28 species) in Europe.
Phylogeny.
The phylogeny of the genera of <a href="Rhinantheae">Rhinantheae</a> has been explored using molecular characters. "Rhinanthus" is the sister genus to "<a href="Lathraea">Lathraea</a>", and then to "<a href="Rhynchocorys">Rhynchocorys</a>". These three genera share phylogenetic affinities with members of the core Rhinantheae: "<a href="Bartsia">Bartsia</a>", "<a href="Euphrasia">Euphrasia</a>", "<a href="Tozzia">Tozzia</a>", "<a href="Hedbergia">Hedbergia</a>", "<a href="Bellardia%20trixago">Bellardia</a>", and "<a href="Odontites">Odontites</a>". "<a href="Melampyrum">Melampyrum</a>" appears as a more distant relative.
